node.title: Victoria's outbreak has been holding steady. But with Omicron likely circulating, the future is 'highly uncertain'
node.alt: A group of pedestrians walking along a footpath by the Yarra River on a sunny day.
node.description: With the new strain of COVID-19 likely to already be circulating in Victoria, bringing back some minor restrictions would be prudent, anÂ epidemiologist says.
node.content:
["Before Victorian authorities flagged likely Omicron community cases in Melbourne\u00a0on Wednesday, epidemiologist James McCaw was relatively confident about the trajectory of the state's COVID-19 outbreak.", "\"Pre-Omicron, I was really quite confident that things [were]\u00a0going to be steady, or just continue to improve,\" he said.", "Now\u00a0he's less certain, and he says it's likely we will have to sit with that uncertainty for the time being.", "\"Now that Omicron's here, we just don't know enough about it yet to know what the future holds,\" he said.", "While authorities\u00a0are taking a more conservative approach to contact tracing around the potential Omicron outbreak, there have been no new restrictions announced so far.", "
So what do we know about Omicron's spread so far?
", "On Wednesday, the Victorian government confirmed one case of Omicron in hotel quarantine, and two other potential cases of the variant\u00a0in the community which were under investigation.", "The infected person in hotel quarantine arrived from the Netherlands via Abu Dhabi in the United Arab Emirates.", "The potential community cases in the local government areas of Brimbank and Casey are being genomically sequenced. Both have returned results with an S gene dropout, a trait associated with the Omicron variant.", "Those cases have no known links to international travel.", "Contact tracers have identified contacts of those cases and some have been asked to quarantine for 14 days, while others have been instructed to isolate until their test results are in.", "The Victorian Department of Health says it has\u00a0begun leading a \"strong outbreak response\" in the wake of the\u00a0initial cases of concern being\u00a0detected.", "Dozens of cases of the variant have already been identified in NSW, and Queensland has also picked up on multiple cases in hotel quarantine in recent days.", "Epidemiologist Nancy Baxter described the speed at which the variant had spread around the world as \"pretty breathtaking\".", "\"You're seeing it now starting to take over in the UK,\"\u00a0she told ABC Radio Melbourne.", "\"They think there are over 1,000 cases in the UK.", "\"[There are] cases in about 40 countries, all over the United States and now here in multiple states.\"", "\"It's real and it's really likely to take over as the dominant form of COVID \u2026\u00a0quite quickly in Australia.\"", "
How concerned should Victorians be?
", "It's important to note that we still have a lot\u00a0to learn about Omicron, and there have been some reassuring signs.", "Yesterday, Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt said Victoria and the rest of Australia were well equipped to deal with the Omicron variant.", "\"We have new hope that the vaccines will protect against serious illness and hospitalisation and loss of life from Omicron,\" he said.", "\"And each day we have new hope, on evidence from around the world, that this may be a milder form of the disease.\"", "", "
Epidemiologist James McCaw says introducing\u00a0light restrictions in Victoria would be \"prudent\".(Supplied: University of Melbourne)
", "Professor McCaw said although it was clear Omicron was a \"highly transmissible\" strain, it was still too early to say what the consequences of its spread would be.", "\"The international scientific community and epidemiologists are doing everything they can as quickly as possible to learn more about this new strain and to understand what the best responses are,\" he said.", "He said despite that, \"we just don't know enough yet\".", "\"The future with Omicron circulating is still highly uncertain,\" he said.", "\"It could be bad or it could be manageable, but we don't know yet, and that's a hard thing to accept.\"", "
Are we likely to see significant restrictions again?
", "Professor McCaw said it would be wise to reintroduce light restrictions sooner rather than later.", "He said bringing back mask-wearing in some indoor settings and minor restrictions on density would be \"prudent and proportionate\" at the moment.", "\"If Omicron does shape up to [have the]\u00a0potential for a major impact, the earlier we respond, the better, and the less likely we would be to end up in another lockdown,\" he said.", "\"These early, pre-emptive changes to policy that have a minimal impact on society but do help us manage this virus would be sensible.\"", "Professor McCaw said even if the state government did not introduce changes, individuals could make choices that would help stop the new variant from spreading.", "\"We all probably still have masks in our pocket or in our drawers at home and we could choose to wear them, say at the supermarket,\" he said.", "\"We can choose to get tested. We can choose to take some precautions that have minimal impact on our lives \u2026\u00a0but they could slow the spread of this virus.\"", "
How effective will our vaccines be?
", "Professor McCaw said although experts were still trying to establish how effective existing vaccines were against Omicron, the booster program rolling out at the moment would help protect people.", "\"Following that\u00a0booster, or the third dose, there is an enhanced protection compared with the second dose and what we hope is that that enhanced protection will be long lived,\" he said.", "\"While that protection may be less against Omicron and Delta, it will still be there\u00a0and it will still help.\"", "He encouraged anyone eligible\u00a0to receive a booster COVID-19 vaccine dose to go and get it.", "Mr Hunt had a similar message.", "\"It is likely that the Omicron variant will be more transmissible, but there is emerging evidence that the vaccines are likely to provide strong, clear protection against serious illness, hospitalisation and death,\" he said.", "Professor McCaw said people should remember their actions continued to play an important role in how the pandemic was playing out.", "\"What has kept us safe over the last two years relative to so much of the world is our resilience and our willingness to act in the best interests of ourselves and our neighbours and the rest of our population.", "\"That's still true here.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
